website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you are looking for a single-step model that is higher than most and simple to fold and store. However, it's not the most durable option.
pros: Super easy to fold, so you can tuck it away and forget it when it's not in use
16" design provides more height than most one-step models
Has anti-slip "dots" and a carrying handle
cons: A bit wobbly, so it's not likely to accommodate the advertised 330 lb

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, but fits in tight spaces & I like the extra height
customer_reviews.text: These seem overpriced, but I appreciate that these have a few extra inches in height than the typical folding stools do, and that they fold rather flat. I need to keep one by my fridge and it's a very tight spot to store it in. This is the biggest stool I can use there simply because of how flat it folds down. (I've bought a couple in stores and had to return them because they didn't fit.) Though I am rather insulted by the price, I ended up getting them for closets throughout the house because I like them. So far none have broken, so hopefully it stays that way!
customer_reviews.author: T. Reed

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS!!! COLLAPSED RIGHT UNDER ME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shorter version of this stool and it seemed great, so I bought the 16-inch version. I used it about 3 or 4 times. But I was just on a cement porch (a solid, flat surface) and IT COMPLETELY COLLAPSED UNDER ME! I felt one edge "soften" and it gave way. I'm lucky I wasn't seriously injured! As the directions say, I had both feet firmly planted, I am well under the rated 400 lbs. (I'm 225) and I was on a secure, solid flat surface (concrete). THIS PRODUCT IS DANGEROUS... DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Presumably

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kids
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our toddler. He can fold/unfold it himself and it allows him better access to the kitchen and bathroom sink. When he is not using it, it fits nicely out of the way. We liked it so much that we bought a second!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, practical, and love the color!!
customer_reviews.text: I got the red 16 inch step stool because I have a wonderful loft bed and I absolutely hate climbing up and down ladders (especially in the middle of the night, lol). This is just the right height to make my second step down from the sturdy children's dresser I got. Also, it coordinates with all the red in my room 😁. I was a little concerned because I'm not exactly a feather (Just weighed in at 220) but I have never felt like this was anything less than solid, sturdy craftsmanship. It's a little higher than a normal step up, but for my purposes, it's PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Sedai

customer_reviews.title: Stable and folds flat for storage.
customer_reviews.text: This is very convenient. It even has a handle when folded. The handle integrates smoothly with the top when the stool is open for use. I also use it for my cat to sit on in the shower, so I don't have to bend so far over. Yes, my cat gets a bath once a week, and he really appreciates that it doesn't tip like the small folding table I've been using.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Collum

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this stool so much that I ordered two in the initial order then ordered another. The first two were flawless, but the recent order arrived broken (more a shipper issue than Acko). Of course upon contacting Amazon a new one was sent. We use these for the large SUV, to wash and reach the top for loading. Also use these indoors to safely reach items on higher shelves and to sit on while working on a project outside. They easily collapse to a very flat, perfectly stored item. They are very sturdy and rated for 440lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my RV, light weight folds flat stores easy and is strong, great item. Fast delivery and free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: TJ RODS

customer_reviews.title: this thing is absolute garbage...
customer_reviews.text: So it says, it can support 450lbs... i am a big guy (i know it, but i am one handsome MF!!!), and i was standing on the this piece of crap at 300lb... and this thing collapse... 450lb??? Absolutely not!!! I have another step ladder which is shorter,; there is a very noticeable difference between the material my solid good hard plastic step ladder vs this Acko super flimsy weak collapsing fall down stool... one more thing, my shorter step stool is rated at 300lb, had it for 2 years, and it still works well. all in all, I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE to anyone... i plan on putting up some pictures soon...
customer_reviews.author: Pro-FoodChoice

customer_reviews.title: Warning 75 lb weight limit sticker on the step stool. Picture attached - Amazon will be sued.
customer_reviews.text: The description on this step stool says up to 400 lbs. The step stool has a warning label 75 lb limit. This is misleading, someone is going to miss seeing the warning sticker, fall and get hurt... and sue Amazon. You know, more than the waste of money, I hate my time being wasted. I purchased this for my 100 lb daughter to use in her bedroom closet - now I would not want her to use it. If she fell and got hurt- I knew the weight limit. (sigh) does any company do the right thing anymore?
customer_reviews.author: Tired Undertaker

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy to use as a stepstool
customer_reviews.text: It has a weight limit of 75lbs. Yes, the description says 300lbs, but that's assuming a perfectly evenly-distributed weight load that isn't moving. When you're standing on this, your weight is using about 1/3 of the surface area of the step. Also, it's 16" high. Unless you are 8 feet tall, you're going to have to put 100% of your body weight on one foot while you are lifting yourself up t get the other foot up. That puts even more stress on the plastic. If you weigh any more than 75lbs, it absolutely will break after a few uses. It's probably safe to use a stool to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: The Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: This stool is great in my kitchen. I store it in the tiny space between my refrigerator and the wall, so it's very handy to get out for use and immediately put away afterwards. Love the way it opens and closes - no fiddling around, no pinching of fingers. I got the taller one of the two (16 inches) because my cabinets go all the way to the ceiling, but since there is only one step, the step up is a big hop up. That's fine for me as I can manage it, but it might be a bit difficult for someone with limited agility. In that case, I would recommend going with the shorter version.
customer_reviews.author: DAOHIOTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, easy to take anywhere and use for standing or sitting.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retail merchandiser and I use this stool for work as I go from one store to the next. It folds easy and is light to carry but sturdy enough for me to sit or stand on all day. I'm 230 Ibs and I feel safe standing/sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is well constructed and weighs almost nothing, my kind of product! It folds flat and has been a huge benefit for work I have to do in 3 big chicken coops. It sits outside 24/7 and has had no ill effects. I’d get 10 more if I actually needed them-
customer_reviews.author: MAY1958

customer_reviews.title: Stool construction questionable
customer_reviews.text: Side hinges snapped cleanly off by just unfolding the stool for it's first use. In the process of returning stool now.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easily opens and closes
customer_reviews.text: Need the additional height for getting up off of a stool. Due to back injury can get down low,sit and still be able to get up. Sturdy easily opens and closes
customer_reviews.author: jget55

customer_reviews.title: Conflicting weight rating
customer_reviews.text: The advertised weight capacity is 400 lbs. Stool is wrapped in clear plastic with a white sticker that reads a weight capacity of 400 lbs. The sticker that is on the stool itself reads a weight capacity of 330 lbs. With the two conflicting weights, I decided to return this and purchase a different one. I believe the weight capacity stated on the label affixed to the stool itself is the correct one.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is very convenient to store
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is very convenient to store. I have a shorter one and it was not quite tall enough for me to reach the top shelves in my kitchen. This is just right. It seems sturdy to me. I do not feel unstable at all using it. I love that it folds up easily and it has a handle for carrying from place to place. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LInda

customer_reviews.title: Slender but Strong
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It is exactly as described. It's so lightweight and slender that I don't have to hide it in a closet. It slides perfectly in the niche next to the refrigerator...and, it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Francine

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy, light, easy to hide away!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to reach the high cabinets in the kitchen. This fits the bill just fine. Sturdy enough for my 200+ weight and easy enough to grab, set up, fold up, and squirrel away for another time.
customer_reviews.author: SuperCoder

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy stool.
customer_reviews.text: I love these stools. I have a new corgi pup and had short gates in our doors that my cats can jump over, except for our oldest cat. We use one stool on one side of the doggie gate, he hops up on top of it and over onto another chair on the other side and then hops down. I also use this stool to reach items on top shelves too. Very sturdy and love the color. You do need to be sure that the folded legs are fully extended before climbing on to it.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Shopper 2016

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest little stool! Very sturdy, easy to manuever, and takes up almost no space. I love it so much, I got a second one for the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect aid for us, the vertically challenged
customer_reviews.text: I own a cosco step ladder but I dislike having to take it in and out of the closet every time I want to reach the higher levels of the pantry. Besides it is kind of heavy. So this step is just perfect to solve this problem since I can store it besides the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Nice step
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but a little flimsy. I purchased this product for putting my bikes on my rooftop car racks and it gets the job done. It’s stores flat and compact. I’m 210 lbs and have lifted a 35 lb mountain bike up on it so it can hold the weight but make sure it’s on stable flat ground before using it like I do.
customer_reviews.author: GREGG COLLICHIO

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description
customer_reviews.text: It was not as described. It came with 2 stickers on it. One said it can only hold someone 75 pounds. The other referenced the weight it can hold as in a box being placed on it. I bought it as a step stool thinking that it could hold my weight which is a normal adults weight. The description online was not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stool because I needed something lightweight, sturdy and easily stored that had enough height to allow me to reach my top cabinets easily. This product meets all these needs and exceeded my expectations regarding quality for the cost. This is stool is an exceptional value!
customer_reviews.author: K. LAFAVE

customer_reviews.title: Weight capacity standing is 75 lbs. The higher weight is sitting only
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old metal stepstool that had seen better days. Shopped a bit and found this one on sale. Bought it due to the 300 lb weight capacity. Once I recieved it and looked at the label on it I was very surprised to see a weight limit of 75 lbs. So happy that I checked before trying to step on it! So if you are larger than a child and looking for something to use as a stepstool to actually step on - keep shopping. If you are looking for something to sit on that is light easy to carry and fits in small spaces this is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Meri

customer_reviews.title: Only supports standing weight of 75 lbs
customer_reviews.text: There's a misconception of this stool holding up to 350lbs. If you are using it as a step stool, that is standing on it, it says it only supports up to 75lbs, which is a small child's weight. I am sure many people mistake it as you can step on it if you weigh below 350 lbs. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: cbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Stool Snapped after less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August 2018. Was perfectly happy with this stool. Was as advertised. Until today. Was standing on stool to put some items on top shelf of kitchen cabinet which is our main use for this stool. Suddenly the stool snapped and I was on the floor. Banged my knee but lucky I was not hurt more seriously. I weigh 130 pounds LESS than the maximum weight recommended and was holding a 16 ounce box of salt so it was not a weight issue. We live in an apartment so this stool is stored in a cabinet and has never been stored outside. Not good and NOT super strong.
customer_reviews.author: Hsiang-Fu Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Limit to actually use as a stool is 75 pounds. Don't let this dump you on your A**.
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart during its second use. A corner popped apart, once it did so the bottom of one quadrant bent.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G. Whetten

customer_reviews.title: MAXIMUM STANDING CAPACITY 75 LBS???
customer_reviews.text: Step stool was just delivered today. I noticed the MAXIMUM STANDING CAPACITY 75 LBS sticker (see photo) before I took off the shrink wrap. What use is this as a step stool for adults??? Unfortunately, I’ll be sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Piece of Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be rated to hold 440 lbs. My husband used the stool twice and it fell apart with him standing on it the second time he used it. This was the replacement order as the first stool arrived cracked. Considering what he was doing, he is lucky he was not seriously injured. This is a real piece of *expletive deleted*.
customer_reviews.author: D. Salvaryn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me pulling weeds and doing home projects.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, perfect!!! I have bad knees so it's difficult bending over and probably not a pleasant sight - haha I bought this stool at 16" so I could use pulling weeds as well as doing projects in my home. I am 5'7" and 16" is perfect, unless my knees are acting up I can actually get up by myself without holding on to something.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Looks good in the ad...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product, but within 2 weeks the top cracked and part of the hinge on top came loose. I use this a stool to sit on for breaks and lunch in the factory I work in. I was nice to fold up and put in my tool box, to keep someone from walking away with it. I didn't abuse it in anyway, so I'm surprised that it broke so quickly. I don't believe I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Home PC poseur

customer_reviews.title: Solid sitting stool.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a few of these plastic fold out type stools in the years and this one appears to be made the best thus far. It seems to be a fairly sturdy seat that could handle a 270 pound man sitting on it. I haven’t stood on it yet but that’s not what I bought it for being 6’3ft I never needs step stool, lol. The other caveat which is awesome is it actually has a handle that comes out when you fold it which is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa n John

customer_reviews.title: love, love, love this stool
customer_reviews.text: its lightweight, portable, functional and durable. I have a disorder that zaps my energy in a short period of time. So I'm always under a time constraint to get as much completed around the house as possible, before I'm trained and need to sit and recharge...almost like a battery (lol). I use the stool to conserve energy (by sitting) while cleaning the inside of the fridge, the lower kitchen doors or inside the oven. I've also used this stool while organizing dresser drawers, rearranging the lower shelves content and cleaning out lower shelved of closets. This stool allows me to conserve energy while still maintaining an independent life.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: More sturdy than it looks!
customer_reviews.text: Im over 320 lbs and been using this thing to stand on to access the roof of my SUV. We just tied down some things to the top and this was evaluable in assisting me in doing that. I was worried the weight limit wouldn't hold up but im above it and have had no issues. I can see if i shifted my weight drastically while on it, it would break but i am confident in myself and this product. Not to mention it takes up such little room i dont even notice it until i need it. It was a good purchase and already paid for itself in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Changing first review - dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I thought this was great. And it was, for a couple of months of light duty. Then one day sitting on it as I sanded trim, the step stool broke apart underneath me into 3 or 4 large pieces, several medium pieces, and numerous small pieces. Because I was on the landing of the stairs, the complete shattering of the step stool made me go down the stairs. Thank goodness I was sitting and doing the trim, rather than standing and doing the upper trim. I weigh 150. The step stool had been opened properly and used properly. If you buy this, beware that this could happen to you.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but not as sturdy as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: My unit easily folds up just by lifting the middle of the top step up. Unfortunately, quick and easy folding seems likely to be part of why it feels unstable and likely to easily fail. I weight about 240lbs, so only about 80% of the max 300lbs rating. Moving around while standing on top of it, it feels a bit like taking a chance, but it works. I did worry slightly about it collapsing if if were bumped from the side or the weight on the top wasn't well distributed. If the pieces "snapped" into place, it would probably make me more confident about its design.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Snapped when I was standing on it and I fell to the ground.
customer_reviews.text: This says it will hold up to 300 pounds. I weigh 200 and this thing snapped as I was standing on it (with both feet on the platform as shown in the graphic). This should not be advertised as a step stool. It is dangerous and now a waste of money as there is no buyer protection or warranty. Do not buy this design- look elsewhere for your next folding stool.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooo necessary.,
customer_reviews.text: I have a metal stair fold up step stool. Such a pain in the ask to pull out all the time to change a light bulb. This is my second one. I keep one in the kitchen that’s shorter and this one in my bedroom because my closet has high shelves and the vent for air conditioner is super high and I open and close the vents a lot. I just leave it folded up behind the bedroom door. It’s folds super thin and it’s sooo lightweight. The metal one I have is good too a as nd folds think but it’s heavy. Good price. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Turner

customer_reviews.title: BUSTED!!! Dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. Stool broke when I sat on it. I bought it because it stated it could handle my weight, which is 265. It didn’t. I busted my butt....and the stool. I wasn’t hurt. I was using it on a stable, concrete floor. I bought 2 and will trash even the unbroken one. Beware! Thankfully, I was not standing on it at time of failure.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck U

customer_reviews.title: Seriously lacking quality control.
customer_reviews.text: If "Super Strong" means coming directly from the supplier with a giant crack through the top of the stool, then I wonder what less than super strong means? I know that's a little snarky, but seriously, it's a stool...it has no other higher purpose. It does one thing. And if no one at Acko could take a moment to look at it for plainly obvious and major defects before it went into the box, then I have to wonder how many less-than-obvious things might be wrong with this line of products. Where is quality control?
customer_reviews.author: Pixelpilot

customer_reviews.title: Handy stool is perfect for garden use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 70-year-old flower gardener who needs to sit on a low stool while weeding. The regular garden bench/kneelers are too heavy and awkward to carry. So I decided to try this low-cost alternative. It's perfect. It weighs very little, folds up flat when I pick it up by the handle in the middle of the seat area, and is very easy to carry. It's a lot sturdier than I expected. I got a red one so I'll be able to see it easily in case I forget and leave it in the yard. Wish I had discovered it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product with many functions
customer_reviews.text: This ended up being fantastic. I bought it to use with a futon because when its open its low to the floor and my husband could sit his computer on. But he never used it much. But I decorate a lot outside for the Christmas. And I have to put u hooks (ordered from Amazon) 150 hooks for all the decorations. I'm normally on my knees in the snow hammering in the hooks and its cold!! This year I used his stool and sat on it while I hammered in all the hooks for all the decorations in the yard. And I'm plus size I also use it for cleaning ceiling fans. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: donna k.

customer_reviews.title: Great When You Need a Boost
customer_reviews.text: I traded in my Kia Soul for a Jeep Cherokee and it's a just a little bit too high for me to easily get my SUP (standup paddleboard) on top of the roof rack. A fellow paddler showed me his neat little folding step stool and I promptly ordered mine from right there in the launch area's parking lot. My stool arrived in time for the next weekend's paddle and it was great having this sturdy platform to stand on while loading up. It takes up virtually no room in my vehicle and sets up in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great stool
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it a couple times. I weigh a little over 200 lbs and it has not had a problem supporting me, though when I step on I can tell I am approaching its limits. The taller height is perfect for getting hard to reach items or using it as a seat.
customer_reviews.author: SR-GR

customer_reviews.title: It's only for sitting
customer_reviews.text: Well, for one thing, this stool holds 330 lbs only if sitting on it. The other side says "holds 75 lbs" for standing. I was going to use it as a stool to stand on and change lightbulbs or get to high cabinets. It's definitely not sturdy enough for me, 150 lbs, to stand on. It's only high enough for my tall 4 year old to get on it herself. Also, my baby picked off one of the spongy dots before i caught her and put it back on since they are just stickers. That is kind of a choking hazard. So think about all these things before buying it for yourself or kids.
customer_reviews.author: MissFire

customer_reviews.title: The Acko folding step stool is not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Acko Folding step stool to use around the house. While I found the stool to be easy to unfold and light weight, I also found that is is not sturdy at all. The stool is rated to 300#, I weigh 154#, While no light weight, I'm far removed from 300#. When I stepped on the stool, the lower cross support cracked. So I really cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hunton

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE ~ BROKE ALREADY ~ DEFINITELY NOT HEAVY DUTY OR SUPER STRONG
customer_reviews.text: This unit broke during only its third use. These plastic stools from Acko are absolute garbage. I want a refund and a $50.00 shipping, handling and wasted time fee as well. To avoid the aforementioned $50.00, drop your return requirement. This is getting ridiculous boys and girls.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket to reach the top shelves.
customer_reviews.text: I own several of the shorter (11") versions of this folding stool and love them. I needed a taller one, however, to reach the top shelves in my kitchen and laundry room (I'm somewhat vertically challenged at 5"1"). This is just the ticket. I do recommend hanging onto a sturdy nearby support when stepping up onto the stool (assuming you're not a giant) just to be safe. It's a pretty big step up. Like other folding stools you also need to be mindful of where you place your fingers when closing up the hinge...it's easy to get pinched. Because it's so useful and takes up so little space --I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenLightGirl

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't use it for heavy things.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very bright and cute step stool. After ordering I got in just a couple days. Very quick. Upon setting it up I found that it does not lock in well. The side legs stay a bit folded even. I would not trust it to actually stand or sit on it. I only wanted it to hold a container of treats, outside, for the delivery persons. It will work well for that. Plus, the bright red catches the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Momma1965

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my granddaughter to help in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: My 3yo granddaughter gets this out & totes it about to where she wants to use it. It is nice because it folds up out of the way when it isn't needed, and I can use it occasionally to reach high up items. Very sturdy. I got a taller height so I could use it to sit on when doing some tasks as well. It's a perfect height so my granddaughter can help. I gave the extra to my daughter for same purpose, until 2nd granddaughter is old enough to need it here.
customer_reviews.author: LianaN

customer_reviews.title: Great stool if you want to fall on your ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stool and used it less than a dozen times before it snapped while my husband was standing on it, who is WELL UNDER the weight limit. Thankfully he wasn't seriously injured. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Denise C

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stool so that I wouldn't have to kneel when cleaning the "kitty condos" at the two local Petco stores where I volunteer to help maintain the enclosures for the adoptable cats. I can sit on this stool, shifting my 250 lbs. all around, and it remains solid and secure. It is comfortable enough for my 20-30 minutes of use at each store. I'm happy with my purchase, and have even recommended the stool to strangers who've inquired about it.
customer_reviews.author: ChazW

customer_reviews.title: Now I can reach the top shelf
customer_reviews.text: A nice height for me to reach the top shelf of my closet. It aslo works as a quick sit down and put shoes on, stair. I have several of these but different heights. Stores nice and flat. Very reliable and quick to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and retract
customer_reviews.text: I have hiked on the Appalachian trail and a few lesser known trails. I wish I had known about this trekking pole. This one is so easy to open, adjust, and collapse for stowing. It has incremental adjustment marks and easy to adjust, firm locks. The hand grip is comfortable. It comes with a carry bag, (for storage I assume) and accessories for a variety of terrain/surfaces. I did find on one hand grip an annoying fastener edge which I fixed.
customer_reviews.author: W Moore

customer_reviews.title: Broke while I was standing on it!
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks off & on using this to reach the higher places while painting the interior of our home, I was removing a nail & it broke while I was standing on it, sure am glad that hammer didn’t come down on my head! Definitely doesn’t hold 300 pnds! I’m not even have that weight!
customer_reviews.author: Whip

customer_reviews.title: It opens and closes just fine. However make sure you check the whole step ...
customer_reviews.text: It opens and closes just fine. However make sure you check the whole step stool before you use it. Mine had a metal staple embedded in the side of the stool near the hinge. I was able to remove it, but some of the plastic was punctured due to the metal staple. Also it came was slightly dirty so I had to wipe it down clean.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Great for Old Men
customer_reviews.text: These are great for old men to have around to sit on when needed.....16 inches are fine for standing up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Camping Buddy
customer_reviews.text: As my knees refuse to cooperate, this height is becoming my best friend for camping. I had a 13 inch before which I loved but gave to my daughter and son in law who love it (as I knew they would) for their remodeling projects (floor work, painting lower walls etc..) This size is perfect for servicing my trailer (read use the dump station). Four stars only because you have to watch this one as you pick it up: it swings super freely which is nice... but will trap your fingers if you’re not careful. Learned my lesson, love this lightweight yet sturdy stool. You can stand on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Good simple well constructed product... the first one I purchased was the size smaller 13" as I recall... I am now using that as a step within my in ground hot tub / spa... to ease myself into that nice small pool of warm water. WARNING - it floats and will be swept away with the spa jets foaming around it... need to have the jets off as you enter... The larger one is a replacement for using in my kitchen to get to the higher objects within the tall cabinets of my home...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Miner

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: When I received it, I thought right away it wasn't sturdy and low quality but I didn't return it. Then few months later, the top handle just broke under my foot (and I am not overweight at all) splitting basically the entire top. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SYLVNY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I needed a step stool to use to get into the bed of my pickup. The 16 inch works perfectly and when done I fold it up and put it back into my truck. The built in handle minimizes the risk of pinched fingers. May 24th update: This stool has been used so many times my wife finally asked for one for the kitchen area. Great product. Folds flat for storage and easy to open. That built in handle is a great feature. When finished using the stool just grab the handle and lift the stool and it folds up for storage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Too high of a step.
customer_reviews.text: I actually have to hold onto something to get onto the step stool. Before you buy this try stepping up 16". I can step up that high, but to actually shift your weight and get onto the step stool is almost hazardous. I do have short legs, but not that short. Also, when I am on it, it does not seem very stable. Opening it up, you need to be sure that it has "caught."
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: totally contradictory labeling
customer_reviews.text: This product came with a sticker on one side saying it was rated for up to 350 pounds, and a sticker on the other side saying it was only for 75 lbs and under!! Which is it?! Either I can use it or its only for a child, and I don't know which. I guess I'll know if I use it and it collapses under me and I break my ankle!
customer_reviews.author: lagirl

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool a few months ago and it has already broken. I bought this to reach upper cabinets in my kitchen but I needed a folding stool as I live in an rv and do not have much space to store things. This says it holds up to 330 lbs but I'm only 140 and my fiance is 220. Neither of us are even close to meeting the max weight but yet it is already broken on the part we step on. Obviously I'm outside of my return window on this product so I'm stuck with a broken stool. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Alley

customer_reviews.title: 5 ⭐ for vertical help!
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller version of this and have always wished it were a bit larger. I'm 5ft so I'm always in need of vertical help. When I saw this I had to get it and am so glad I did. It's made well, pretty much the same as the smaller, store bought version, and the extra height is perfect. It's nice and light and can be stored anywhere. Totally worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Catattack

customer_reviews.title: If you have old knees-- DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I had GREAT difficulty getting second leg up on this stool as it's quite high and push from knee to get fully on was quite hard; same getting down. I accidentally stepped on large opening to steady my getting down and the whole thing broke completely. Had it one day. Stick with metal and if going for height, make sure there are TWO STEPS!! Ellen G
customer_reviews.author: ellieg

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and Fold up
customer_reviews.text: There are other stools that look similar to the Acho stool . I saw one for several dollars less at our local hardware store but it was not easy to open and even harder to fold. This stool opens very easily, is stable, and closes automatically when the handle is lifted.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a portable stool
customer_reviews.text: I work in the A/V field and often need to move around a project and then park myself to wire up devices or equipment racks. This is perfect for that. Folds up flat for convenient storage and has a handle to carry it around very easily. Folds back into a stool with one hand. Should support me if I need to stand on it (I'm 160lbs) but I really am using it for a short chair.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen helper
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful when trying to reach on top of cabinets, changing light bulbs, etc. It's sturdy enough to stand on, but I wouldn't try to jump on it or wobble around. It's tall enough to use as a simple chair, too. It's very lightweight and easily folds to store behind refrigerator or any other out of the way nook.
customer_reviews.author: Rougemont

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stool, we moved into a new house and the top of the cabinets are too high for me. This easily folds and can hide in the kitchen and I can get it out when needed. My toddler also loves that he can get it out and wash his hands and help at the counter. Stylish and a great accessory to any home.
customer_reviews.author: StacnJeff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and durable. We have used these everyday since we bought them. I’ve had many step stools like this that weren’t as heavy duty and good quality as these. I also love the height of these. Bought the 16-inch and they are the perfect height to reach the top shelves or for washing the top of our cars. They collapse easily and are slim enough to store anywhere. If you are particular like me, I even appreciated that the packaging labels on each side of the stools removed very easily. I didn’t have to use any effort or adhesive remover to take them off. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Hinges separated after 2 1/2 months. Only used for sitting. I weigh 190. Legs broke first then the hinges. The design has caused it to have a minimal area for hinges causing a reduction in strength. Used it to sit on sometimes uneven surfaces while working on gas meters, the uneven surfaces probably led to it's demise. Purchased another Brand without so many " holes" and more plastic area/ hinges
customer_reviews.author: J.F. Coocoo Yo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little stool. First the pink color is cheerful. I live in a small space and this folds up and I can put in a narrow space. Unfolds very easily. Folds back up with a slight pull of the handle. Great for reaching top shelf of my closet. Easy to reach top shelves of all my cabinets. Even over fridge. So I would say a great little stool.
customer_reviews.author: boomer

customer_reviews.title: the product is not worthy of standing on it, very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The stool is not stable at all, breaks down at the opening, the product is not worthy of standing on it, a very disappointing product
customer_reviews.author: very pleased

customer_reviews.title: Be smart! Stand where it tells you to and it'll carry the weight
customer_reviews.text: Be smart! Stand where it tells you to stand and it'll hold the weight. I use this all the time because I'm short and my truck is tall... don't be rude. I haven't had a problem. I stand on the sides where the instructions tell you to. My fat friend almost broke it because he almost stood in the middle, where I told him NOT to stand. Be smart and it'll do the rest
customer_reviews.author: Armosrock7

customer_reviews.title: Good stools
customer_reviews.text: These stools are great for short Adults reaching tall shelves or for a toddler to reach a sink to wash their hands. That said, the ones that were delivered were dirty and had to be cleaned before we used them. They were dirty despite being wrapped in plastic so I can only assume they left the factory this way.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Up

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight step stool or seat.
customer_reviews.text: I have many of these in different heights and love them because they are very compact when folded and they are ultra lightweight. We have one in every closet for those times when you need to reach something on the upper shelf. This particular one is the tallest that I have and I keep it outside hidden behind shrubbery and use it as a seat when gardening. My husband uses it as a seat when working on the car or mower.
customer_reviews.author: batty

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Not only a waste of money but a safety hazard. Just got around to making use of this stool I purchased back in May and the first time using it and it snapped below me. I was fortunate as I came very close to smacking my head on the pavement... only wish I knew sooner because now I am out the money too!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Step stool completely broke in a dangerous way.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an average size person. After using it for a few months, I stepped on it, putting all my weight on it, and it broke in the middle, tumbling me to the floor. See photos. I wrote to the company, who asked for photos, and then didn't send a replacement. Save your money and buy a higher quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Eamazon

customer_reviews.title: Best little device to sit on
customer_reviews.text: I use this step stool to sit on while I do various jobs around the house that require a lot of bending over to accomplish. This use to be a pain, but now I'm perfectly comfortable while sitting and no bending. Sure it is a good little boost too stand on, but because of weak legs this is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: bluesmoker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stool
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why we never bought these stools before as we've lived in our house for 20+ years. Bought a red and black stool. Husband loves his for cleaning his tires when washing the vehicles. I've used it for organizing kitchen cupboards-perfect. Sturdy and priced well. Happy consumer!
customer_reviews.author: enjoyremodeling

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Broke while standing on this stool.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. It broke apart, and I fell to the ground. Now I have a bunch of bruises n swelling. Terrible product . Tried to return, but couldn't...return window closed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: Great stool
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried after reading some reviews about it breaking. I am 260#. I bought this for a vacation trip where I needed to use a car carrier to put luggage on top of an SUV. I used the heck out of it and it stood up nicely. Now it's in our walk in closet for the Mrs to get things off the high shelves. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S.

customer_reviews.title: CONFUSED ON WEIGHT INFO
customer_reviews.text: Received this item today. My concern is one side says can hold up to 300 lbs and the other side says 75 lb limit for standing? Why would there be a difference. I may be returning this item for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Toni C

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and hides well
customer_reviews.text: it's pretty hard to find a stool that has some height that isn't super bulky and heavy. I'm a little vertically challenged at 5'3 but I didn't want it keeping me from maximizing my closet space. I added a pole at the top of my closet to hang some items and need something that can hide in a closet but allow me to easily pull it out and reach things. I suppose I could have used maybe 2 more inches but on the whole, it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Some give in the top platform, but very sturdy legs.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but I weight 118lbs. I think if you were overweight or a large person, this would not seem as supportive. There is some give in the top platform area in the center. However, the legs are sturdy. I have purchased many of these as I am short and they are so easy to pull out and be able to reach the top shelves of things.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Great stool!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one for several years, and love it. It's a perfect height to sit on when you don't want to kneel -- which, as I get older, I want to do less and less! It's also fine to stand on, though it's a bit higher than I usually need (I have the same stool, but a little lower, for that purpose). It's lightweight and easy to move to where you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Very useful as a collapsible stool
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little stool. We have the shorter versions that work great for simple one step up situations. We use this one for a bit more height, and it makes a terrific short stool, when you have to temporarily get up close to something. Just pop it open and you've got it seat. I use it, in particular, when accessing my two draw lateral file, that isn't otherwise near any seating.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: I feel so much taller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my new master closet, which has shelves that only Andre the Giant could easily reach. The stool is great, opens and closes easily, and is sturdy enough to use even after I've had a few beers and gotten a hankering to put away some laundry. Cheaper than the alternative available at the local box store and appears to be exactly the same stool.
customer_reviews.author: Brien P Crotty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for untying shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'11" obese male that has difficulty untying shoes when I get home from work. This stool is the perfect height for me to get my foot up higher for untying shoes. It does not flex and has never collapsed in the time I have been using it. Personally, I would never try to stand on it, the folding parts on the sides do not lock into place, they just have plastic tabs that rest (loosely) in a groove along the underside of the platform. A skinny person should have zero problems standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: RedOneStandingBy

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, and a perfect height
customer_reviews.text: This collapsible stool tucks away flat, carries easily, and is a perfect height for reaching light bulbs, ceiling fans, or sitting in the garage organizing or sawing that one piece, OR for kids to easily reach a faucet...
customer_reviews.author: John - Psychotherapist

customer_reviews.title: Great Stool and Great Price!*
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy (though standing in it is the only way to "lock" it in place), good height and light weight. *The only caution I give is the little padded foot inserts fell out twice while I was examining it. I'll crazy glue them and advise you do the same. They're an unusual shape so once they're lost, you're just out.
customer_reviews.author: jbdean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY what I've been looking for. I have the smaller one which is sold just about everywhere, but I needed a few inches more in height. However, I wanted something light that would fold up flat so I could keep in in the kitchen area without it getting in the way. This fits the bills exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Casey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great for kids too
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect height for my two year old to use herself to stand and cook with me at kitchen counter. She can unfold it herself s s get on it by herself. So handy to fold and keep next to refrigerator. Use it everyday. It’s strong too, I am a large person and can stand on it to reach something also.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hoagland

customer_reviews.title: Rated for 75 lbs standing weight, but holds up to 330 lbs?
customer_reviews.text: The product has mixed information. I’m sure it could hold more than 75 lbs but I returned it before I opened it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly super strong
customer_reviews.text: Stool broke while trying to put away something in the top cabinet above the fridge. I weight 150 lbs and had this item for a year. Thankfully I was able to land on my feet, but sustained some bruises on my arms (I was able to hold onto the fridge thanks to my good reflexes). I fear my wife or anyone else would not have had the same luck (I have good reflexes). 100% would not recommend for anyone unless you weight under 150 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this stool. It store nicely, hold well someone on it too. My complaint with it is that the folding parts are not sturdy nor durable. It broke as I got off the bench. I hook it with my forefoot. Of course I should hot have hook it, but I still believe there should be a way to make this stool a 5*
customer_reviews.author: Claude M.

customer_reviews.title: Stools for my little helpers
customer_reviews.text: I have these in my kitchen so that my 4 year old and my 2 year old can "help" in the kitchen. They take them out and [ i ] put them back easily. They no longer drag chairs in to my kitchen every time they want to get something off the counter. Im not sure they would hold a 200 pound person. But for kids its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: orly jackel

product_meta.title: Acko 2 Pack 16 Inches Super Strong Folding Step Stool for Adults, Kitchen Stepping Stools, Garden Step Stool Black
feature_bullets: ✔【Safe Upgrade Folding Stepping Stool】:Features improved the folding bar,which can prevent from collapse inward while standing on it.Acko have designed a safety stop gap feature that allows the foldable stool to prevent being squashed. Four round corner super safe protect your body from clashing. All of this design is put user safe first.

✔【PREMIUM QUALITY 】- Our fold up step stool made of tough & durable heavy duty plastic for long lasting durability and has been approved by EN 14183 Certificate.The maximum load capacity of the folding stool is 300lbs, which safe for kids and adults.

✔【Space Saving Foldable Stool 】: This foldable step stool is super convenient. It's quickly and easily folds away for convenient storage so you can opens with one flip of the hand. Its foldable nature makes it super compact (only 1.5" wide). Store it virtually anywhere and it’s ready to give you a 16 inch boost or seat!!!

✔【Portable Folding Stool】: Lightweigh folding stool great for in the kitchen, bathroom, rv's and more.When you go out for a picnic, are you worried about is there not enough room for place stool?Carry this quick-fold step stool wherever you go.

"✔【QUALITY GUARANTEE】-Keep using quality materials to ensure the best quality.Sweet satisfaction with half of Year comprehensive warranty. ✔【Note】For safety's sake,make sure stool is fully open before use.The step stool must be used in dry and flat surface. Mustn't place the product in the environment above 30℃ and below﹣5℃ more than 5 hours."

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,340 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
